1346 Connecticut Avenue
Washington 6, D. C.
Dear Mr. Harley:
I have your letter of March 15, 1962 with regard
to the so-called Griffin amendment to the educational tele¬
vision legislation (H. R. 132).
I agree with you that the kind of activity engaged
in by educational television community organizations should
be encouraged and that the legislation should not disqualify
such organizations from receiving grants. It is my hope
that something can be worked out in conference to assure that
such organizations will be entitled to Federal grants.
